Entries.default: This old wooden table bears a complicated alchemy set, several bottles, and assorted other materials.
A large chunk of faintly luminous fungus rests in a small metal bowl.
You empty the bowl of fungus into a pouch and secure it among the rest of your gear.
The bottle weighs heavily in your hand. It is apparently quite full.
Through a cautious application of alchemical procedures, you purge the toxins from the beaker, replacing it with a potent admixture of growth enhancers.

After a few hours bent over the beakers and tubes, [Specified 0] announces success. Your companion passes you the bottle with a wry grin. 

"Careful you don't get that on any spores you don't want getting significantly larger."
Despite hours of frustrating effort spent hunched over the beakers and bottles, the fungicide remains as deadly as ever.
Though antique, the alchemy set has been well-maintained and looks entirely serviceable.
A corked bottle rests in a metal cradle, cleverly labeled with a red X imposed over a rough image of a dank spore. It appears to be a potent fungicide.
[Apply a small portion of the bottle's contents to the fungus.]
The fungus shrivels before your eyes, its faint light fading. With a quiet puff, it deflates entirely.
The fungus bloats before your eyes, sprouting tendrils that slide up and over the lip of the bowl. Its glow brightens, pulsing like a heartbeat.
